Reviews.Title: Dead after one year
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to this model about a year ago from a 4 channel. Seemed to work fine for the year. Would randomly reboot but always came back. Yesterday it quit and won't power back on. Checked power supply voltage which was fine. It has no power switch and the leds on the mainboard come on. Hdd is fine. PCB is toast.  Always kept it on a surge protector and I live in an area that really doesn't have weather so no lightning or moisture. These DVRs never get any firmware updates. UI was cumbersome but that's relatively normal for most of these cheap dvrs. Won't be giving zmodo any more business.

Reviews.Title: Network setup tricky to get set up and running.
Reviews.Author: Paul R. Lusk
Reviews.Content: Can be a little tricky to set it up for network use.  Had to open up ports in my firewall for it to work.

Reviews.Title: This DVR is horrible!
Reviews.Author: J. C
Reviews.Content: I recently got the 4 channel CIB DVR and wanted to upgrade to an 8 channel DVR. The ZMODO was lower price so I thought I would give it a try. Connecting the cameras was pretty straight forward but everything else afterwards was a mess. The configuration menu is horrible. You actually need the remote control to set the IP of the DVR. The password for admin and user don't work. Resetting it also doesn't work. The client software doesn't look like you can manage the DVR from a computer. I've setup quite a few surveillance DVRs and this is by far the most frustrating. What a piece of junk. Just pay for the CIB DVR and save yourself a lot of headaches.

Reviews.Title: Bad quality control for these units
Reviews.Author: Suburban Pro Studios
Reviews.Content: I had previously purchased one of these units for use in my business, but ended up having to replace my unit as mine original was taken for evidence in a crime. I immediately purchased a replacement as I was happy with my initial system. Two units later I'm giving up on these as the quality control is terrible.I've just received two units in a row that won't recognize their hard drives consistently. Removing the hard drive shows that it works fine in a computer, but as soon as its back in the DVR its unrecognizable after a restart. I am able to format the drive inside the DVR and it begins recording, but as soon as I power cycle the unit the troubles begin again.Same problem twice leads me to believe that the units aren't well made. Leaving my business security in jeopardy is unacceptable and I'll be moving on to a different company for my needs.

Reviews.Title: Great with some quick free fixes
Reviews.Author: andrew "PFC Brian"
Reviews.Content: Great DVR.  I added my own hard drive to it and have had no issues.  Very easy set up.  The mobile software they say to use wouldnt work with my PTZ cameras however i found out APLAYER works great with this DVR.  Computer software has some issue as well.  If you are using any OS past XP (7,8, Vista ) you will notice that the program will  not run right and will not let you log in.  Zmodo customer care said i would have to just use the internet explore to view the cams on a computer.  However if you are good with computers you still can use the software.  After install right click on the desktop icon and click properties then the Compatibility tab and check the box run in windows xp mode and check run as administrator.  That will allow you to use the software however everytime you run it it will ask you for permission to run.  Also your first time log in use the word "root" for user name and password will be what ever you set on the dvr itself.  Over all this DVR is great for the price.  If you have a old computer laying around save the Hard drive and use it on this DVR and save yourself some money.
